This date also marks the 20th anniversary of the Space Shuttle Challenger explosion. I was a Senior in high school when the news of the disaster came out. Let's remember the six astronauts and schoolteacher Christa McAuliffe who perished on that fateful ride to the stars.
Coincidentally enough, this coming Wednesday also marks the 3 year anniversery since the Columbia accident. I know they are completely different situations, but lets not forget them either.

No, the loss of the two Shuttles caused more space fatalities than all other accidents combined. I remember it well...... I was 11 at the time and saw it on the childrens news on the beeb when I got in from school that afternoon.
 
 Oh, and Challenger did not explode, it experienced a very rapid burn-off of propellant in the external fuel tank resulting in the aerodynamic failure and break-up of the Orbiter :p

 Getting overly technical, are we :)
If only the reports that the O-rings had malfunctions in cold weather had been clearer, maybe the decision to launch would have been cancelled, saving lives.
